head.title: Only Bills for Sale By U.S. This Week

identified-content.classifier: Top/Classifieds/Job Market/Job Categories/Banking, Finance and Insurance

hedline.hl1: Only Bills for Sale By U.S. This Week

block.p: The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.24 percent and a six-month bill was at 5.32 percent.
The Treasury's schedule of financings this week is confined to today's regular weekly auction of three- and six-month bills.
By the close of the New York cash market on Friday, traders said, the rate on the outstanding three-month bill was 5.24 percent and a six-month bill was at 5.32 percent.
The following taxable and tax-exempt fixed-income issues are scheduled for pricing this week: TAXABLE
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Federated Department Stores, $400 million of senior notes due in 2002, Ba1/BB-/---. Goldman, Sachs & Co.
Hollywood Casino Corp., $190 million of senior secured notes due in 2003, ---/B+/---. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Regency Health Services Inc., $100 million of senior subordinated notes due in 2002, B2/B-/---. Bear, Stearns & Co.
Service Corporation International, $300 million of senior notes in two parts. Baa1/---/---. J. P. Morgan Securities.
Source: MCM CorporateWatch
Ratings: Moody's Investors Service/Standard & Poor's/Duff & Phelps Credit.
TAX-EXEMPT
TUESDAY
Boston, $75 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
Mercer County, N.J., $50 million of general obligation bonds. Competitive.
ONE DAY DURING THE WEEK
Arizona Transportation Department, $255 million of revenue bonds. Smith Barney Inc.
Mercer County, N.D., $100 million of refunding revenue bonds. Morgan Stanley & Co.
San Bernadino Joint Powers Finance Authority, Calif., $115.6 million of taxation allocation revenue bonds. Miller & Schroeder Financial Inc.
Wisconsin Housing and Development Authority, $70 million of home ownership revenue bonds. Bear, Stearns & Co.
